trans-unit.source: Retrieves information that describes the changes within the specified directory

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves information that describes the changes within the specified directory

target.mrk: Retrieves information that describes the changes within the specified directory

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: A handle to the directory to be monitored. This directory must be opened with the $FILE_LIST_DIRECTORY access right.

seg-source.mrk: A handle to the directory to be monitored.
This directory must be opened with the $FILE_LIST_DIRECTORY access right.

target.mrk: A handle to the directory to be monitored.
This directory must be opened with the $FILE_LIST_DIRECTORY access right.

trans-unit.source: The filter criteria that the function checks to determine if the wait operation has completed.

seg-source.mrk: The filter criteria that the function checks to determine if the wait operation has completed.

target.mrk: The filter criteria that the function checks to determine if the wait operation has completed.

trans-unit.source: This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

target.mrk: This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

trans-unit.source: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_FILE_NAME

seg-source.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_FILE_NAME

target.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_FILE_NAME

trans-unit.source: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_DIR_NAME

seg-source.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_DIR_NAME

target.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_DIR_NAME

trans-unit.source: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_ATTRIBUTES

seg-source.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_ATTRIBUTES

target.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_ATTRIBUTES

trans-unit.source: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_SIZE

seg-source.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_SIZE

target.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_SIZE

trans-unit.source: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_LAST_WRITE

seg-source.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_LAST_WRITE

target.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_LAST_WRITE

trans-unit.source: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_LAST_ACCESS

seg-source.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_LAST_ACCESS

target.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_LAST_ACCESS

trans-unit.source: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_CREATION

seg-source.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_CREATION

target.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_CREATION

trans-unit.source: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_SECURITY

seg-source.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_SECURITY

target.mrk: $FILE_NOTIFY_CHANGE_SECURITY

trans-unit.source: A pointer to the DWORD-aligned formatted buffer that internally used by this function to retrieve the data.

seg-source.mrk: A pointer to the DWORD-aligned formatted buffer that internally used by this function to retrieve the data.

target.mrk: A pointer to the DWORD-aligned formatted buffer that internally used by this function to retrieve the data.

trans-unit.source: To create a buffer, you can use _WinAPI_CreateBuffer() function.

seg-source.mrk: To create a buffer, you can use _WinAPI_CreateBuffer() function.

target.mrk: To create a buffer, you can use _WinAPI_CreateBuffer() function.

trans-unit.source: To prevent the crash of the script, use the buffer at least not less than 64 KB.

seg-source.mrk: To prevent the crash of the script, use the buffer at least not less than 64 KB.

target.mrk: To prevent the crash of the script, use the buffer at least not less than 64 KB.

trans-unit.source: If the buffer is greater than 64 KB and the application is monitoring a directory over the network, the function fails.

seg-source.mrk: If the buffer is greater than 64 KB and the application is monitoring a directory over the network, the function fails.

target.mrk: If the buffer is greater than 64 KB and the application is monitoring a directory over the network, the function fails.

trans-unit.source: This is due to a packet size limitation with the underlying file sharing protocols.

seg-source.mrk: This is due to a packet size limitation with the underlying file sharing protocols.

target.mrk: This is due to a packet size limitation with the underlying file sharing protocols.

trans-unit.source: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

seg-source.mrk: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

target.mrk: The size of the buffer, in bytes.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether to monitor the subdirectories of the specified directory, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether to monitor the subdirectories of the specified directory, valid values:

target.mrk: [optional]
Specifies whether to monitor the subdirectories of the specified directory, valid values:

trans-unit.source: True - Monitor the directory tree rooted at the specified directory.

seg-source.mrk: True - Monitor the directory tree rooted at the specified directory.

target.mrk: True - Monitor the directory tree rooted at the specified directory.

trans-unit.source: False - Monitor only the specified directory (Default).

seg-source.mrk: False - Monitor only the specified directory (Default).

target.mrk: False - Monitor only the specified directory (Default).

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: The 2D array containing the following information:

seg-source.mrk: The 2D array containing the following information:

target.mrk: The 2D array containing the following information:

trans-unit.source: [0][0] - Number of rows in array (n)

seg-source.mrk: [0][0] - Number of rows in array (n)

target.mrk: [0][0] - Number of rows in array (n)

trans-unit.source: [0][1] - Unused

seg-source.mrk: [0][1] - Unused

target.mrk: [0][1] - Unused

trans-unit.source: [n][0] - The file name relative to the directory handle.

seg-source.mrk: [n][0] - The file name relative to the directory handle.

target.mrk: [n][0] - The file name relative to the directory handle.

trans-unit.source: [n][1] - The type of change that has occurred (one of the $FILE_ACTION_* constants).

seg-source.mrk: [n][1] - The type of change that has occurred (one of the $FILE_ACTION_* constants).

target.mrk: [n][1] - The type of change that has occurred (one of the $FILE_ACTION_* constants).

trans-unit.source: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

seg-source.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

target.mrk: Sets the @error flag to non-zero, call _WinAPI_GetLastError() to get extended error information.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: When you first call _WinAPI_ReadDirectoryChanges() function, the system allocates a buffer to store change information.

seg-source.mrk: When you first call _WinAPI_ReadDirectoryChanges() function, the system allocates a buffer to store change information.

target.mrk: When you first call _WinAPI_ReadDirectoryChanges() function, the system allocates a buffer to store change information.

trans-unit.source: This buffer is associated with the directory handle until it is closed and its size does not change during its lifetime.

seg-source.mrk: This buffer is associated with the directory handle until it is closed and its size does not change during its lifetime.

target.mrk: This buffer is associated with the directory handle until it is closed and its size does not change during its lifetime.

trans-unit.source: Directory changes that occur between calls to this function are added to the buffer and then returned with the next call.

seg-source.mrk: Directory changes that occur between calls to this function are added to the buffer and then returned with the next call.

target.mrk: Directory changes that occur between calls to this function are added to the buffer and then returned with the next call.

trans-unit.source: If the buffer overflows, the entire contents are discarded.

seg-source.mrk: If the buffer overflows, the entire contents are discarded.

target.mrk: If the buffer overflows, the entire contents are discarded.

trans-unit.source: To obtain a handle to a directory, use _WinAPI_CreateFileEx() function with $FILE_FLAG_BACKUP_SEMANTICS flag.

seg-source.mrk: To obtain a handle to a directory, use _WinAPI_CreateFileEx() function with $FILE_FLAG_BACKUP_SEMANTICS flag.

target.mrk: To obtain a handle to a directory, use _WinAPI_CreateFileEx() function with $FILE_FLAG_BACKUP_SEMANTICS flag.

trans-unit.source: The _WinAPI_ReadDirectoryChanges() function works only in synchronous mode.

seg-source.mrk: The _WinAPI_ReadDirectoryChanges() function works only in synchronous mode.

target.mrk: The _WinAPI_ReadDirectoryChanges() function works only in synchronous mode.
